Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is somewhat run down and old - but the price is right. recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Bed Bugs Bite!”
Reviews.Author: Rita3107
Reviews.Content: Friend & I were coming to Sydney for a show at the Capitol Theatre so wanted a conveniently located hotel for the night. The Sydney Metro was just right...across the road. We were in a standard twin on the 3rd floor. Firstly, the bathroom could have done with a very good scrub up, for although it badly in need of a reno, a good clean with some Exit Mould may have made a difference. My friend who took the double bed woke in the morning scratching. She had bites on her arm and torso. A frantic inspection of the bed revealed a couple of bloody spots and the offending creatures lying dead (hopefully) on the sheet. On check out I quietly handed the creatures ( in an envelope) to the receptionist telling her they were found in the bed. She expressed no surprise and made no apology, but commented she would get the pest control people in. It seemed total dismissal of the problem. We won't be going back to the Metro Central.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: The hotel has refurbished rooms which they describe as "superior", and non-refurbished ones, which I guess are...inferior. I consciously chose one of the latter because, oddly enough, it was cheaper. Check-in was quick and efficient and the reception staff very friendly and helpful. My room was clean and functional but, being on the third floor and looking out on to walls and a courtyard, pretty dark and gloomy. Fine for just one night but if you were here for a few days I suspect it would start to get depressing. The bathroom was a bit knocked about but clean enough and everything worked. As other reviewers have noted the location is a fair hike from the harbour but very handy for shopping (the big World Square mall is nearby, including a big supermarket), pubs (all of which do decent food) and public transport. This is the backpacker part of Sydney and so there are plenty of cheap eateries around, usually Asian.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....for some (and the rooms are OK)”
Reviews.Author: HolaGatitos
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned the Metro Center hotel is really well positioned for much of the city. Hyde Park is a couple of blocks away, Darling Harbor maybe ten minutes by foot, but this is also on the edge of Chinatown and right in the middle of the backpacker scene. Translation, lots of good cheap food nearby, but sort of busy and, depending on your age, you may feel the area is a little like hostel heaven with plenty of nighttime diversions. The rooms are somewhat, but mine seemed to have been recently updated. Nothing to write home about, but clean, functional, and for the price, I thought the place comes off as a little" boutique-y." THe have wireless internet in the rooms, but there is a charge. Save some money and go to one of the dozens of internet cafes that surround the area. If you are a foodie looking for good cheap Asian food, this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sarac9978
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful here. They gave us good recommendations, gave us a fan, and were helpful with directions. We weren't here much because we were out on the town mostly. The room was comfortable and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “The location is the best part of it”
Reviews.Author: HeartinNature
Reviews.Content: We found the room with 2 double beds cramped and the lighting was not convenient. Breakfast provided was functional - same menu every day. Did not find the staff very pleasant (except for an Australian lady and another man).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: UMSK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located.... near to Central and Town Hall station's - easy access to most of the places around Sydney City... staff is friendly and helpful - rooms are maintained

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: allblackgirl
Reviews.Content: Was not at all impressed with this hotel - when paying $235 a night there are certain things you come to expect like polite staff, amenities that work, a clean bathroom, towels that cover an averaged sized butt and a superior queen room that is big enough to fit in more than a double bed. On arrival they had lost our reservation (luckily I had printed it off the computer as proof) so they upgraded us for free - quite frankly if this was a superior queen I would not like to see what the average room was like! The young lady that was on the desk during the day was incredibly rude and unwilling to help with any tourist information. They have a spa (one of the reasons why we stayed at this hotel) but it was out of order the whole trip. The worst was the breakfast (not included in the price). On our first morning we decided to treat ourselves to the breakfast in their restaurant but it was awful. They fried up luncheon sausage and tried to claim it as bacon, the juices were the same as the watered down stuff you serve at a childs birthday party, no fruit avaliable and the eggs looked like the plastic stuff served at McDonalds. They do have the internet but only one computer for the whole hotel to use and they charge about 5 times as much as the local internet cafe and they only let you use it at certain times during the day. For half the price this hotel would be fine but is definitely not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. It is 3 minutes walk to Chinatown or Central station. The rooms are newly renovated, but for some reason they did not renovate the bathroom. The bathroom must be about 20 years old. Check out the shampoo and soap in public toilet like dispensers. There were multiple maintenance issue with the room, with missing light bulb and non-flushable toilet. Even assuming the light blub was working, the room was very dark. However, overall there was nothing seriously wrong with the hotel. If the rate is good, I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: motherpig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Metro Hotel for 7 days/6 nights in mid Feb. The booking was for a twin room (the cheapest room) as I was travelling with my mum. We were given a triple room on 4th floor. The room was ok, no light on ceiling. Lights are located beside the bed and dressing table which is very annoying. The worst part was the bathroom. Mould everywhere. I slept next to the bathroom. On our first night, the ceiling in the bathroom was leaking and water dropped onto the bath tub. I couldn't sleep for the first night. The next morning, my mum found the vanity was full of water so all our stuffs were wet. It turned out the water was leaking along the ceiling panel all the way to the vanity. Floor was wet as well. Rang the reception and they quickly sent two guys to fix it. By taking the ceiling panel off and all the rusty pipes were exposed. I was going to take a shower but didn't do it as it was disgusting to even stand inside the bath tub. We came back in the afternoon and they have put in a new panel so we thought the problem was fixed. How wrong? I took a shower then and it was a nightmare. Water pressure was so low and temperature kept changing every few mins. I stood there naked and trying to fix the temperature. The shower took me more than 30 mins to finish. I was very angry by then as I know my mum will not able to do that. I rang the reception again and demanded to speak to the Manager. Got hung up twice for no reason. Finally spoke to the Manager and complaint about the shower. He decided to upgrade us to Superior Room on 6th floor. He didn't mention about the extra fees for the upgrade. Anyway, we moved room and it was such a big difference. It was one of the refurnbished room and I tested the shower and it was perfectly fine. No drama after that. When we checkout, I then found out we were charged the extra fees for th upgrade. It was lucky that it wasn't a huge amount but I would have thought that they would give us a free upgrade due to the condition and problem with the old room. Location is fantastic. Within walking distance to Central station and Chinatown. Plenty of places for eating. We even walked to Exhibition centre without any problem. The lift is ok to us. But during our stay, I have seen so many visitors were having problem using their key to operate the lift. I even helped a few. Overall, the staffs were nice and quick to response. But the condition of the Hotel is questionable. If you intent to stay in this Hotel, I strongly suggest you stay in one of the Superior Room or above. Definately not the cheapest one.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Chooka84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for 4 nights after returning from a 2 weeks stint overseas - had to fly back to Sydney anyway before returning home to Brisbane, so extended the holiday to round off the week here. Location-wise, you couldn't be in a better spot! 5 min walk to train station. Close to Mall, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay... Twin room was requested but we got a triple - the room is not big enough for three beds!! part of the ceiling panels were lifted away from where it should actually be. air conditioning didn't work because the vents were so full of dust. Requested for someone to fix it - but no one came. Black marks up and down the walls. No light in the room other than a lamp next to the TV and the bathroom light. You could feel the springs in the mattresses - beds very uncomfortable! Bathroom was disgusting. It was small and no where to hang wet towels. Mould in the grout on the floor, mould all over the wall tiles, mould on the ceiling and rust under the paintwork. Bathroom exhaust vent was full of dust and absolutely filthy. Handles on the taps in the shower were broken and despite requests to have it fixed, no one came to fix it. Then the plug got stuck in the hand basin while it had water in it. Requested someone to fix it - again - no one came. We were forced to spit in the bathtub or toilet when brushing our teeth to avoid making the water that was in it any dirtier than it already was. OUr keys had to be re-cut or changed on seven occasions because we were being denied access to our rooms and to our floor. We got stuck in the lift twice. The lifts were an ongoing issue. Was left waiting for a lift for 20 minutes. After 10 minutes, I asked to use the stairs only to be told by reception that there were no stairs at all in the building. Later, I found the emergency stairs that said, "for use in emergency only"... I'm sorry but if the lifts are out of order - you should be permitting use of stairs. Wasn't the fact that they didn't think this was an emergency - was the fact that they told me that there were no stairs at all in the building, which at the time, questioned my own safety in the hotel itself. We chose this hotel for the use of the rooftop pool and to check out the view. We were repeatedly denied access to the rooftop. Only got up there once when escorted by a staff member after we continued to go to reception to complain. Part of the pool step was chipped away and sharp - not safe in my opinion. We took photos of the condition of the room and pool and bathroom... we have forwarded a formal complaint to management with the photos. We have requested a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton but good enough”
Reviews.Author: salt_pepper867
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room for four nights from 25 Feb - 1 Mar 09. Size of the room big enough for two of us, clean and large windows. Comfy bed and pillows. A/C works although there is no control in the room. Cleaning product scent a little overwhelming. Lifts a little slow and unreliable. A fair distance from Circular Quay/Darling Harbour but Central Station is just a few minutes walk away and there are plenty of places to eat and drink within a couple of hundred meters of the hotel. Good enough to return to after a day out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Jane&Pete
Reviews.Content: I have,a number of times written scathing remarks,justified of course,about some hotels my wife and I have stayed in in various countries and cities. The original Mr Grouch. We have just had a week with two friends in the Metro City Central,and its my pleasure to say the four of us were delighted with the vfm.At about 350 uk pounds we had very clean comfortable rooms in the centre of the city with everything close at hand.The staff were without fail,courteous,helpful and cheerful. I have no hesitation in saying you would be hard pressed to find a better hotel at the price,and I did spend many hours surfing (cool dude or what?) Tip. If you haven't walked the bridge,do it-fantastic.Photo of two oldies attached.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: holidaynz77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the refurbised rooms and thought they were good value for Sydney. The location near the train station was handy when getting to the airport . You could walk to China Town and Darling Harbour. The hotel will look after your bags if you arrive before check in time. Some airline staff use the hotel and so it can by busy at times in reception. Overall good value for the location

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surpise given the price”
Reviews.Author: SuzukiTochigi
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this site we were somewhat skeptical but decided that for the money we had to spend that it was our best bet. Firstly we were delighted with the location and check-in staff were very effiecent and pleasant enough. We arrived beofre check-in time so arranged to have our bags stored until 2PM when our room was ready and went walkies to the local shops and china town (less than 5 mins walking). Our room has clean and quite spacious. Bathroom could of been bigger but did the job. All in all it was a decent hotel for the money paid and would recommend it to the traveller who wants comfortable accommodation without the 5 star price tag - ideal for the shopper like my mrs and no need for taxis etc as the location was so central to everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “ITS FINE”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was fine and reasonable value for money. This together with its closeness to Chinatown, public transport, markets, etc make it our first choice when we need to stay in Sydney CBD. The cost of parking (we paid $25 in a nearby parking station) certainly adds substantially to the cost but hey it is the centre of the city and that's clearly what the market will bear.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Happy076
Reviews.Content: This hotel had wonderful friendly staff in the heart of the city at a reasonable price. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: sunnyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very average. The had a twin room which was average, the bed base was broken, you could feel the metal spring of the bed. The toilet were so small, there is not enough place to move. The tap were leaking. Good thing was staff were friendly and the Hotel is close to train station. But if you are driving as I did it is better to stay further than CBD as it is difficult to drive as there is lots of traffic (Use GPS it will help).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jnaujoks
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest hotel I could find downtown for a night and was very pleasently surprised. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. When the shuttle to the airport broke down, they gladly got us a taxi ride instead. Room was clean and contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Only satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Talandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights which would be the maximum recommended. Good location. The room was very small. The 'king' bed was two single beds pushed together which meant that there was a very hard strip up the middle, in effect my wife and I slept in 'separate' beds. Very nice bathroom, but there was a continued unpleasant smell coming from the drains. Room did not get cleaned one of the days until after we returned after 5pm. Pleasant staff. A nuisance when the key card did not work which necessitated a trip back down to reception when we were in a hurry. Not great signage outside of hotel - the taxi driver did not know where the hotel was. Adequate, but would not stay there again. Have had better value from other hotels in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 3 days/nights at Metro Sydney Central. Perfectly located- very short walk from World Square shopping centre,monorail ( husband loved position as hates walking anywhere!!) Staff very pleasant and helpful, lovely freshly renovated room(had booked standard but may have been upgraded as had 2 double beds and very spacious)-great value at $109 per night booked direct onMetro Hotels website-no room service but who needs it when so many food choices just outside in street). We have stayed at Menzies and Novotel Darling Harbour on previous visits to Sydney but much prefer Metro Sydney Central as better value and good location-not far to wharf areas and other attractions. Looked at my other mid range choices but I am so glad that I chose this Hotel and will definitely be staying here on future visits to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: randexpo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Metro with my daughter for two days. It was my first visit to Sydney and I could not have chosen better. The hotel is centrally situated, the rooms were lovely and comfortable quiet and clean and the staff were very helpful and charming. We were waiting for our pick up to the airport, on our departure and the transport was very late, we were getting a bit concerned but the reception did all they could to assist us. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again. Carol B

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: time2roam
Reviews.Content: Time to update this review page maybe. With few beds available this weekend, I took what I could find ... namely The Metro. I booked a standard double and having then read the reviews here, I regretted it. I shouldn't have worried. On arrival the staff were courteous and helpful and sorted out a booking problem I had. On booking they said they couldn't guarantee a non-smoking room, but they managed it. Even before I'd checked in, I'd been upgraded to a superior double/queen for some reason (I wasn't game to ask why). The room was small but clean and modern, as was the bathroom. Not a lot of storage space, probably due to the second double bed in the room .. yup TWO double beds. (But no plug for the bath) Facing Pitt St was a little bit noisy if the curtains were open but nothing that kept me awake or woke me up. (Try and get a rear facing room if you can... the view from the front isn't very scenic anyway) One of my friends was in a standard room and it too was clean and pleasant and the only difference was that the decor was a bit dated. They seem to have dropped the luggage storage fee which was good. All in all, with the location, the price and the amenities were all better than expected (and I've travelled a lot so I know a bad hotel when I see it).

Reviews.Title: “Bad attitude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Alison6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of my trip to Oz. Id got a feel for the attitude of Australian people by this time and was very disappointed with the service here. The reception staff were miserable and unhelpful. The room was fine, nothing special, but clean and a comfortable bed. The location was quite good, but still a 20 minute walk to the Quay. I think that there are probably better places to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “glorified hostel”
Reviews.Author: jjireland
Reviews.Content: absolute [--], stayed here for 4nights, was meant to be 6 but left 2 days early, rooms small and manky, first room they tried to put us in, the bathroom reeked of urine. the second was not much better. the only thing going for it is location

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: christymesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Nov. for 2 nights and when we got there we just gave our name and had to sign a form, there was a slight problem as the hotel had overbooked but they had upgraded us to the Master Suite so we were absolutely delighted with the LCD screen and the very comfortable bed. The sheets were great and the views absolutely fantastic. Not a bad walk to any other place. Paddy's market less than 5 minutes away, the central station a 10 minute walk, the monorail, light rain, trains and buses all just a few metres. Complimentary water each night, such a sweet thing. They put a lot of effort into our stay each night and every time we walked out of the hotel (we were in a non smoking room) they'd say cya later or when we walked in they would ask us how our day. meal or even our donughts were. Very lovely, very happy with our stay and we will be going back there when we fly over to Sydney in March.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, perfect price”
Reviews.Author: takoyaki_puff
Reviews.Content: The Metro hotel Sydney central was a lovely hotel to stay in. We stayed on the 12th level, although we didn't have any nice views, the room was better than i expected from reading the reviews. Comfortable linen, nice lighting and great paintings in the rooms. We stayed in the superior queen room and it was quite spacious, a bonus was the use of shampoo/condition/body lotion/shower gel in the bathroom. Some improvements that could have been made were the bad reception on the tv and no remote. But other than that a lovely place to stay, extra pillows (we had 5 in our room) , plenty of towels were provided and a great atmosphere. Perfect location to go wondering around the city.

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: rtwcr
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nights on a business trip to sydney. like one of the other reviewers i booked this hotel in error thinking i was going somewhere else. for sydney standards the hotel was ok, just ok. i had a twin room when i requested a double. the standard single beds (not king singles were too small for me - i am 200cm tall). despite several requests on arrival i was not given a room with a double bed - as requested. the staff were efficient but seemed to be terribly overworked and harrassed. i was surprised to be charged to store one smaall bag and my overcoat on the last day after checkout - i had a late flight and wanted to do some exploring. all in all you pretty much get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Lost our Reservation”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo022
Reviews.Content: We had made an online reservation and we had a printed confirmation, but our reservation was missing in their computer system. They had no way to communicate with their central office because it was Saturday. Despite being there at 10 AM they would not give as the room we reserved because they were fully booked, although a large hotel should expect some no show or late cancellation. For one night they would only give us a terrible room with no space and they refused to place us in another hotel or help us find another hotel. Luckily we were able to find another hotel on our own.

HotelInfo.Name: Metro Hotel Sydney Central
HotelInfo.Address: 431-439 Pitt Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
